unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Deep Dive into Recent Vehicle Launches**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Deep Dive into Recent Vehicle Launches**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of activity in recent weeks, with several key launches spanning various segments. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute recently published a detailed report analyzing the impact of these new vehicles on the existing market dynamics.
normalised: The Indian automotive market has seen a flurry of activity in recent weeks, with several key launches spanning various segments. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute recently published a detailed report analyzing the impact of these new vehicles on the existing market dynamics.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled its highly anticipated electric SUV, the 'Nexon EV Max XZ+', boasting an extended range of 453 km and a faster charging time. Initial pricing starts at Rs. 18.79 Lakhs.
normalised: Tata Motors unveiled its highly anticipated electric S U V, the 'Nexon E V Max X Z plus', boasting an extended range of four hundred and fifty three kilometer and a faster charging time. Initial pricing starts at rupee eighteen point seven nine lakhs.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra & Mahindra launched the 'Scorpio-N Adventure Edition', targeting off-road enthusiasts. This variant comes with all-wheel drive and a rugged suspension system. Maruti Suzuki also entered the fray with a refreshed version of its popular hatchback, the 'Baleno', now featuring advanced safety features and a larger infotainment system.
normalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra and Mahindra launched the 'Scorpio-N Adventure Edition', targeting off-road enthusiasts. This variant comes with all-wheel drive and a rugged suspension system. Maruti Suzuki also entered the fray with a refreshed version of its popular hatchback, the 'Baleno', now featuring advanced safety features and a larger infotainment system.

unnormalised: Experts predict these launches will significantly impact the compact SUV and hatchback segments. Market analysts at IIT Bombay are currently studying the consumer response and long-term sustainability of these new vehicles, considering factors like charging infrastructure (especially for EVs) and the availability of service centers covering 5000 sq ft per city.
normalised: Experts predict these launches will significantly impact the compact S U V and hatchback segments. Market analysts at I I T Bombay are currently studying the consumer response and long-term sustainability of these new vehicles, considering factors like charging infrastructure (especially for E V S) and the availability of service centers covering five thousand square feet per city.
